action.action-desc: Mr. Lucas (for himself, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Foster, and Mr. Barr) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Federal securities laws to enhance 403(b) plans, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Retirement Fairness for Charities and Educational Institutions Act of 2023.

subsection.header: Amendments to the Investment Company Act of 1940
subsection.text: Section 3(c)(11) of the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80a–3(c)(11)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: employee’s stock bonus, pension, or profit-sharing trust which meets the requirements for qualification under section 401 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986;
custodial account meeting the requirements of section 403(b)(7) of such Code;
governmental plan described in section 3(a)(2)(C) of the Securities Act of 1933;
collective trust fund maintained by a bank consisting solely of assets of one or more—

clause.text: church plans, companies, or accounts that are excluded from the definition of an investment company under paragraph (14) of this subsection; or
plans which meet the requirements of section 403(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 if—

subclause.text: such plan is subject to title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (29 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.);
any employer making such plan available agrees to serve as a fiduciary for the plan with respect to the selection of the plan’s investments among which participants can choose; or
such plan is a governmental plan (as defined in section 414(d) of such Code); or

subparagraph.text: separate account the assets of which are derived solely from—

clause.text: contributions under pension or profit-sharing plans which meet the requirements of section 401 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or the requirements for deduction of the employer’s contribution under section 404(a)(2) of such Code;

contributions under governmental plans in connection with which interests, participations, or securities are exempted from the registration provisions of section 5 of the Securities Act of 1933 by section 3(a)(2)(C) of such Act;
advances made by an insurance company in connection with the operation of such separate account; and
contributions to a plan described in subparagraph (D)(iv).

subsection.header: Amendments to the Securities Act of 1933
subsection.text: Section 3(a)(2) of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77c(a)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking or (D) and inserting (D) a plan which meets the requirements of section 403(b) of such Code if (i) such plan is subject to title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (29 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.), (ii) any employer making such plan available agrees to serve as a fiduciary for the plan with respect to the selection of the plan’s investments among which participants can choose, or (iii) such plan is a governmental plan (as defined in section 414(d) of such Code); or (E);
by striking (C), or (D) and inserting (C), (D), or (E); and
by striking (iii) which is a plan funded and inserting (iii) in the case of a plan not described in subparagraph (D), which is a plan funded.

subsection.header: Amendments to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
subsection.text: Section 3(a)(12)(C) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a)(12)(C)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking or (iv) and inserting (iv) a plan which meets the requirements of section 403(b) of such Code if (I) such plan is subject to title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (29 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.), (II) any employer making such plan available agrees to serve as a fiduciary for the plan with respect to the selection of the plan’s investments among which participants can choose, or (III) such plan is a governmental plan (as defined in section 414(d) of such Code), or (v);
by striking (ii), or (iii) and inserting (ii), (iii), or (iv); and
by striking (II) is a plan funded and inserting (II) in the case of a plan not described in clause (iv), is a plan funded.
